title: At what point is someone legally responsible for their own actions? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: You are legally responsible for your own actions when you have a full understanding of what is right and wrong. If you’re a minor and commit a crime (misdemeanor or felony), although your parents are responsible for you, you will be held accountable for your actions. As an adult, even if you’re still living at home w/your parents, you are fully responsible for your actions.

You are always legally responsible for your actions. Someone, please help me out here. I see an alarming number of questions like this where the person asking is either psychopathic or mentally challenged. Please let me know I am not alone on this.
